text: I too move my naked and immense hands and feet through the old, high wooden rooms and then out into trees filtering summer sun onto other forms,

text: other statues outdoors, and rest my long arm as in the kiss on a slab of the unworked stone

text: On a bench in the bright sunlight, a woman lies beside the figure of another, reclining like a cat
speaker: Subject

text: Stretches and sleeps again in the sun
speaker: Subject

text: They both look equally alive. One asleep in flesh, the other eyes closed, awake in stone
